text: Edwards County (county code ED) is a county in the U.S. states of Kansas. In 2020, 2,907 people lived there. Its county seat is Kinsley. Kinsley is also the biggest city in Edwards County. The county was created in 1874. It was named after W. C. Edwards, of Hutchinson, a pioneer settler, who played an active role in its creation. ==Geography== The U.S. Census Bureau says that the county has a total area of . Of that, is land and (0.01%) is water. ===Geographic Features=== The Arkansas River goes through Edwards County from the southwest corner to the Pawnee County line near U.S. Route 56. ===Major highways=== Three U.S. Routes go through Edwards County. They all meet in Kinsley. An east-west route, U.S. Route 50 goes around Belpre and Lewis before connecting with westbound U.S. Route 56 in Kinsley. The single road then goes through Offerle and west into Ford County. U.S. Route 183 goes from Kiowa County in the south to Kinsley, where it connects east U.S. 56 as a single highway to Pawnee County. K-19 starts at U.S. Route 50 near Belpre, and goes north into Pawnee County. ==People== ==Government== ===Presidential elections=== Presidential Elections Results Year Republican Democratic Third Parties 2020 79.7% 1,141 18.9% 271 1.3% 19 2016 78.6% 1,037 16.1% 212 5.3% 70 2012 76.5% 1,059 21.5% 298 2.0% 28 2008 73.3% 995 24.5% 333 2.1% 29 2004 72.5% 1,084 25.8% 386 1.7% 26 2000 68.0% 1,062 28.6% 447 3.5% 54 1996 59.9% 1,088 29.7% 539 10.4% 188 1992 40.0% 769 29.5% 567 30.6% 589 1988 53.9% 993 43.0% 792 3.2% 58 1984 67.5% 1,352 30.3% 606 2.2% 44 1980 63.9% 1,409 28.0% 616 8.1% 179 1976 42.5% 1,001 55.3% 1,304 2.2% 52 1972 64.5% 1,534 31.9% 757 3.6% 86 1968 54.9% 1,243 36.8% 832 8.4% 189 1964 39.2% 932 60.0% 1,427 0.8% 18 1960 61.5% 1,588 38.2% 986 0.4% 10 1956 69.9% 1,816 29.7% 771 0.4% 10 1952 76.4% 2,192 22.6% 647 1.1% 30 1948 58.2% 1,627 38.7% 1,083 3.2% 88 1944 65.1% 1,669 34.2% 876 0.7% 19 1940 60.1% 1,886 38.9% 1,219 1.0% 31 1936 41.2% 1,394 58.7% 1,986 0.1% 3 1932 44.4% 1,420 52.9% 1,693 2.7% 85 1928 73.4% 2,171 26.0% 768 0.7% 20 1924 67.0% 1,929 19.0% 548 14.0% 403 1920 70.2% 1,782 26.8% 681 3.0% 77 1916 40.8% 1,158 50.4% 1,431 8.8% 249 1912 16.1% 276 44.4% 764 39.5% 680 1908 50.2% 773 45.7% 704 4.0% 62 1904 64.3% 816 25.9% 328 9.9% 125 1900 50.1% 523 48.1% 502 1.8% 19 1896 39.9% 322 59.3% 479 0.9% 7 1892 45.6% 399 54.4% 477 1888 53.6% 541 33.1% 334 13.3% 134 ==Education== ===Unified school districts=== * Kinsley-Offerle USD 347 * Lewis USD 502 ==Communities== ===Cities=== * Belpre * Kinsley * Lewis * Offerle ==References== ==More reading== * Standard Atlas of Edwards County, Kansas; Geo.
